required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Knowledge and Practice About Prostate Cancer in Male Employees
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Knowledge and Practice About Prostate Cancer in Male Employees of Libbs Pharmaceuticals

brief_summary.textblock: Analyze, through an online questionnaire, the knowledge and practice about the prevention and detection of prostate cancer in male employees of a pharmaceutical company.

detailed_description.textblock: In Brazil, there are still few published and current studies that explore man's attention and awareness of health. Historically, women attend medical appointments and perform routine tests more frequently than men. For this is very important Analyze, through an online questionnaire, the knowledge and practice about the prevention and detection of prostate cancer in male employees of Libbs Farmacêutica (a pharmaceutical company in Brazil).

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of Knowledge and Practice About Prostate Cancer e Healthy Habits
primary_outcome.description: Characterize the participants regarding demographic variables; Assess subjects knowledge and practice regarding signs, symptoms, risk factors and lifestyle for the development of prostate cancer;Assess subjects knowledge and practice regarding ways of early detection and diagnosis of prostate cancer;Assess subjects knowledge of the types of treatment available;Evaluate the frequency of exam performance;Assess the subjects knowledge and practice in relation to educational campaigns aimed at prostate cancer.All the information wil be collected using a questionnaire previously approved by the ethics committee.

arm_group.description: All volunteer male employees of Libbs Pharmaceuticals residing in all Brazilian regions will participate in this research.An online questionnaire will be applied to assess research subjects understanding of prostate cancer and health habits.

study_pop.textblock: As this is a non-probabilistic or convenience (non-random) sampling, the sample size calculation is not applicable. Today there are about 1500 male employees at Libbs Pharmaceuticals and all will be invited to participate in the survey. Answers obtained from all questionnaires filled in their entirety will be included for analysis.
